edu.uprm.ece.icom4015.p3.photo
Class PhotoManipulatorObject

java.lang.Object
  edu.uprm.ece.icom4015.p3.photo.PhotoManipulatorObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
PhotoManipulator
public class PhotoManipulatorObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements PhotoManipulator

This class represents a PhotoManipulator Object, It includes many methods for Photo Manipulations.

Author:
Samuel Rodriguez Martinez

                      int height)
Creates a new empty photo with given width and height.

Parameters:

Returns:

copy

public Photo copy(Photo thePhoto)
Creates a new, independent copy of the parameter photo. This method performs a deep copy of the photo, meaning that all pixel as independent copies of the pixels in the original photo.

Specified by:
copy in interface PhotoManipulator
Parameters:
thePhoto - the photo to be copied
Returns:
the new, independent copy of the original.

isolateRed

public Photo isolateRed(Photo thePhoto)
Returns a new photo that is a copy of the original but with only the red channel visible in all pixels. The remaining channels are set to 0.

Specified by:
isolateRed in interface PhotoManipulator
Parameters:
thePhoto - the photo to be copied.
Returns:
new photo that is a copy of the original but with only the red channel visible

isolateGreen

public Photo isolateGreen(Photo thePhoto)
Returns a new photo that is a copy of the original but with only the green channel visible in all pixels. The remaining channels are set to 0.

Specified by:
isolateGreen in interface PhotoManipulator
Parameters:
thePhoto - the photo to be copied.
Returns:
new photo that is a copy of the original but with only the green channel visible

public Photo isolateBlue(Photo thePhoto)
Returns a new photo that is a copy of the original but with only the blue channel visible in all pixels. The remaining channels are set to 0.

isolateBlue in interface PhotoManipulator
Parameters:

Returns:

grayScale

public Photo grayScale(Photo thePhoto)
Returns a new photo that is a copy of the original but in gray scale. To set gray scale you need to take the average of the red, green, and blue channels of the corresponding pixel in the parameter photo, and set all three levels for the pixel in the new photo equal to this value. You need to round down the averages.

Specified by:
grayScale in interface PhotoManipulator
Parameters:
thePhoto - the photo to be copied.
Returns:
new photo that is a copy of the original but in gray scale.

horizontalStripes

public Photo horizontalStripes(Photo thePhoto)
Returns a new photo that is a copy of the original but with black lines horizontally interleaved with the original image. The first 10 rows look like the original, the next 10 rows are all black, and so on. To create the black pixels, set all three of the red, green and blue channels to 0.

Specified by:
horizontalStripes in interface PhotoManipulator
Parameters:
thePhoto - the photo to be copied.
Returns:
new photo that is a copy of the original but with horizontal black stripes.

verticalStripes

public Photo verticalStripes(Photo thePhoto)
Returns a new photo that is a copy of the original but with black lines vertically interleaved with the original image. The first 10 columns look like the original, the next 10 columns are all black, and so on. To create the black pixels, set all three of the red, green and blue channels to 0.

Specified by:
verticalStripes in interface PhotoManipulator
Parameters:
thePhoto - the photo to be copied.
Returns:
new photo that is a copy of the original but with vertical black stripes.

rotate

public Photo rotate(Photo thePhoto)
Returns a new photo that is a copy of the original but rotated 90 degrees clockwise.

Specified by:
rotate in interface PhotoManipulator
Parameters:
thePhoto - the photo to be copied.
Returns:
new photo that is a copy of the original but rotated 90 degrees clockwise.
